direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods generate and validate Brazilian identification numbers (CPF and CNPJ) with similar logic and validation algorithms.
The validation logic in isCPFValid can be used to test the output of the cpf method, ensuring the generated CPF is valid or invalid as expected.
Both methods handle validation checks and can throw similar exceptions if the input does not meet the expected format.
Both methods use the calculateWeight method to compute weighted sums, which is a key part of the validation algorithm.
Both methods use the digit method to compute the verification digit, which is a critical part of the CPF and CNPJ validation process.
Both methods use the unmask method to remove formatting from the input string, which is a common preprocessing step.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require a BaseProviders instance (faker) to generate random numbers, which is a common setup step.
The isCPFValid method can be used to validate the generated CPF after invoking the cpf method, ensuring the output meets the expected validity.
The formatCPF method can be used to format the generated CPF string, ensuring it matches the expected format.
